wikipedia_page.main: Mark Evans (born 24 August 1970) is an English former professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper.

link_mentions.page: List of Bradford City A.F.C. players (1–49 league appearances)

response: He started his career as an apprentice at Rotherham United in June 1987. He spent five years at Rotherham, but made just five league appearances. Despite serving a promising apprenticeship and helping the club win the Northern Intermediate Cup, he failed to dislodge Kelham O'Hanlon and then Billy Mercer as the number one keeper. After a successful loan spell at Scarborough FC at the end of 1991–92 season, he signed a one-year contract with the Seadogs, where he fought for the starting position with Mark Evans.
